description: Clark's triangle: left border = 0 1 1 1..., right border = multiples of 6; other entries = sum of 2 entries above.
references: J. E. Clark, Clark's triangle, Math. Student, 26 (No. 2, 1978), p. 4.
links: Harvey P. Dale, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: c(n, k) = 6*binomial(n, k-1) + binomial(n-1, k). - _Max Alekseyev_, Nov 06 2005
prog: (Haskell)a046902 n k = a046902_tabl !! n !! ka046902_row n = a046902_tabl !! na046902_tabl = [0] : iterate               (\row -> zipWith (+) ([0] ++ row) (row ++ [6])) [1,6]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 26 2012
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
